frame.name: Be_in_agreement_on_assessment
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Cognizers</fen> have a similarity (or dissimilarity) in their <fen>Opinion</fen>. The <fen>Cognizers</fen> may be expressed separately, with <fen>Cognizer_2</fen> being the basis for establishing the <fen>Opinion</fen> of <fen>Cognizer_1</fen>. Rather than a specific <fen>Opinion</fen>, a phenomenon about which a similar or differing <fen>Opinion</fen> is held, the <fen>Topic</fen>, may be specified. A specific <fen>Opinion</fen> may also go unmentioned when the <fen>Opinion</fen>s of the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are understood as answers to a <fen>Question</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Cognizers">Dr. Gerry and Mr. Pond</fex> <t>agree</t> <fex name="Question">in their impressions</fex>.</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Cognizers">This copyeditor and I</fex> <fex name="Degree">mostly</fex> <t>see</t> <t>eye</t> <t>to</t> <t>eye</t> <fex name="Topic">on things</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Cognizer_1">I</fex> <t>agree</t> <fex name="cog2">with you</fex> <fex name="Opinion">that everything should be monitored to keep the person from wasting time and protecting the interests of the company</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizers
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks constituents that express the set of <fen>Cognizers</fen> whose similarity of opinion is at issue.
</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer_1
FE.definition: <def-root>When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Cognizer_1</fen> is the individual characterized by their similarity in opinion to <fen>Cognizer_2</fen>, whose opinion is assumed to be known. <fen>Cognizer_1</fen> is often an external argument. </def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer_2
FE.definition: <def-root>When the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Cognizer_2</fen> is the one whose opinion is assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing the opinion of <fen>Cognizer_1</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Question
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an implicit question in response to which the <fen>Cognizers</fen> give their <fen>Opinion</fen>s, which are then assessed for their similarity. The <fen>Question</fen> may concern the identitiy of a particular entity, as in the first example below, or it may be of the yes/no-type, as in the second example below. <ex>I think we <t>see</t> <t>eye</t> <t>to</t> <t>eye</t> <fex name="que">in our ultimate goal</fex>, which is that we want to see a democratic Serbia.</ex> <ex><fex name="Cognizers">Almost all anarchists</fex>, in contrast, would <t>agree</t> <fex name="que">in their condemnation of warfare, ie, violent conflict between governments</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are similar in their <fen>Opinion</fen>s. </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are in agreement or disagreement.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The Place is the general area in which the Cognizers are in agreement or disagreement.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is for descriptions of the agreement state not covered by more specific FEs, especially characterizations of the state as a whole or of one of the <fen>Cognizers</fen> or <fen>Cognizer_1</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the agreement or disagreement logically follows. </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the state of the <fen>Cognizers</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Opinion
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs believed by the <fen>Cognizers</fen>.
<ex>We <t>agree</t> <fex name="opi">that babies should not be dropped from helicopters</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>A phenomenon that the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are considering with respect to their <fen>Opinion</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The state-of-affiars under which aggreement occurs (as independent of the act of agreement). </def-root>

lexUnit.name: agree.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have the same opinion about something.

lexUnit.name: see eye to eye.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: completeley agree on a topic or issue.

lexUnit.name: agreement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: accordance in opinion or feeling.
